drupalNodeEvent.title: China's Quest to Protect Its Interests Overseas

field_speakers.processed: Andrea Ghiselli (Assistant Professor, School of International Relations and Public Affairs, Fudan University)

field_organizers.processed: 21st Century China Center, UC San Diego School of Global Policy & Strategy

field_description.processed:
Based on his book, "Protecting China's Interests Overseas: Securitization and Foreign Policy," Andrea Ghiselli, assistant professor at the School of International Relations and Public Affairs at Fudan University, offers insights into the dynamics to foreign policy making in today's China, and to prompt considerations regarding how we understand China's rise.

Ghiselli describes how Chinese presence grew in unstable regions such as the Middle East and North Africa, analyzes how Chinese policy elites understand the protection of the interests overseas, and discuss how the Chinese government's approach to this problem evolved over time, leading to the creation of new institutions and launch of new policy initiatives. The talk will be moderated by Victor Shih.
